labels.analysis: The MCP Server enables the integration of existing automation workflows (scenarios created in Make) into AI assistant environments, allowing AI systems to trigger and interact with these workflows seamlessly. The available tool "Optional Settings" suggests limited functionality (signing in or basic server management), but the primary value lies in bridging automation and AI interaction. This positions the server as a bridge between no/low-code automation platforms and AI assistants.
labels.reasoning: The primary label "Development Tools" was chosen because MCP Server facilitates the integration of automation tools (like Make scenarios) in a way that makes them callable by AI systems, effectively enahcing development workflows. While "API Integration" is relevant (as it enables AI systems to interact with workflows), "Development Tools" captures the broader scope of transforming automation into deployable tools for AI-assisted environments.

remote_server_response.error: unhandled errors in a TaskGroup (1 sub-exception)

server_info_crawled.name: Make MCP Server
server_info_crawled.author: @integromat/make-mcp-server
server_info_crawled.overview: Transform your Make scenarios into callable tools for AI assistants. Leverage your existing automation workflows while enabling AI systems to trigger and interact with them seamlessly.

tools.name: Optional Settings
tools.description: Access and manage servers by signing in.

server_info_crawled.python_sdk:
import mcp
from mcp.client.streamable_http import streamablehttp_client
import json
import base64

smithery_api_key = ""
url = f"https://server.smithery.ai/@integromat/make-mcp-server/mcp?api_key={smithery_api_key}"

async def main():
    # Connect to the server using HTTP client
    async with streamablehttp_client(url) as (read_stream, write_stream, _):
        async with mcp.ClientSession(read_stream, write_stream) as session:
            # Initialize the connection
            await session.initialize()
            # List available tools
            tools_result = await session.list_tools()
            print(f"Available tools: {', '.join([t.name for t in tools_result.tools])}")

if __name__ == "__main__":
    import asyncio
    asyncio.run(main())
